subject: New York City Marathon
lead_paragraph: Jelena Prokopcuka of Latvia, who won the women’s race at the New York City Marathon the past two years, and Marilson Gomes dos Santos of Brazil, the men’s upset winner last year, will compete in this year’s marathon, which is Nov. 4. Last year’s wheelchair champions, Kurt Fearnley of Australia and Amanda McGrory of Champaign, Ill., will also return. The 30-year-old Prokopcuka could become the second woman to win the race three consecutive years. Grete Waitz of Norway won from 1978 to 1980 and 1982 to 1986. A victory would probably assure Prokopcuka, who was second in the Boston Marathon in April, of the $500,000 first prize in the World Marathon Majors’ first two-year series.
